main event: A UFO sighting was reported by a male civilian in Ventura, California on June 8, 1959. The object observed was disc-shaped, had a bright light on the bottom, and exhibited a rotating motion in the sky.
interesting points: The witness provided a written statement and made a sketch of the UFO, but these documents were not included in the report.
The case was classified as 'Insufficient Information' and no further investigation was deemed necessary.
The Air Technical Intelligence Center was unable to find a report from the Ventura, California area for the referenced period, raising questions about the existence of the original report.
The 11th Naval District conducted an investigation into the reported sighting and planned to send the information to the Air Technical Intelligence Center for evaluation.
The UFO report from Little Simes Canyon, California prompted correspondence from the Air Force, indicating the involvement of multiple military entities in the investigation.
sighted object: disc-shaped UFO with a bright light on the bottom and rotating motion
